messages.title: Let down by Labour
messages.content: Backing the Brexit government. Your Labour MP voted with the Conservatives to begin the Brexit process, even though over two thirds of his constituents voted to remain in the European Union. Losing Support. Labour’s support has fallen by 20% nationally in the 20 years since the local Labour MP was elected. A Divided Party. Your MP has publicly stated that Jeremy Corbyn isn’t fit to lead the party – but still votes with him 98% of the time. Labour spends more energy fighting themselves than fighting for residents. Leaving Locals Behind. Labour have been in power here for over 60 years, but Poplar and Limehouse still has one of the highest rates of child poverty in the country, despite being home to some of the UK’s most successful firms.

messages.title: Liberal Democrats are winning
messages.content: Liberal Democrats have recorded an average 20% swing from Labour or Conservatives, and are winning significantly more seats in by-elections. In Combrio, Sarah Olney defeated Brexit-backer Zac Goldsmith. Locally, respected local campaigner Elaine Bagshaw joined the Liberal Democrats after leaving the Labour party because she wanted to fight for a future in Europe.

messages.title: Best by-election performance in 20 years
messages.content: Liberal Democrats have made the largest gains in council by-elections, with a net gain of 31 seats - the best local election swings achieved by any party since the 1980s.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fighting for our place in Europe
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will fight to keep Britain in the EU and retain access to the single market.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A sustainable future for the NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will invest £6bn every year into our NHS to ensure it has a sustainable future.
We will build more affordable homes and ensure fairer renting for residents.

quotes.text: If you elect me, I will stand up for you in Westminster, fighting for local people against Theresa May’s hard Brexit
